summary: Despite a recent ~30% drop in H100/A100 rental prices (from ~$4.50/hr in Q1 2024 to $3.12/hr) indicating some near-term oversupply or demand normalization, the AI industry outlook remains strong. Major hyperscalers (Meta, Microsoft, Google, AWS) have all announced aggressive increases in 2024/2025 Capex, with Meta raising its forecast to $35-40B, Microsoft planning 'material increases', Google accelerating data center buildouts, and AWS expanding AI chip capacity. This bullish Capex surge, combined with anticipation for next-gen models (GPT-5 rumors, Gemini 2), drives the positive index.
